name: honeycomb
content:
honeycomb noun
(STRUCTURE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C or U ] a wax structure containing many small holes, made by bees to store their honey
Erik Rassmusen/Picture Press/GettyImages
[ C ] something with a similar structure: honeycomb of The hotel complex was a honeycomb of rooms and courtyards (= there were many small rooms and passages).

Animal farming - general words
honeycomb noun
(FOOD)
[ U ] UK (UK also cinder toffee); (US sponge candy, sea foam candy) a sweet, light, hard food that can be broken into pieces and is made from sugar, syrup, and bicarbonate of soda: One of the most popular chocolate bars consists of honeycomb covered with milk chocolate. I love honeycomb ice-cream. See also
hokey pokey
Alasdair Thomson/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages

honeycombed
Add to word list
Add to word list
a structure bees make in which to store honey, having many small separate areas, or fig. any space divided into many small, separate areas or paths: The building was a honeycomb of private offices.
